title: Start a FARM in your BACKYARD | Small Scale Regenerative Farming with Nature's Always Right

tasks.task: Travel to a location to perform farming activities
subtasks: Drive to the specified location (Lemon Grove, San Diego)
Assist in cleanup activities
Participate in maintenance tasks for the farm's infrastructure
Engage in conversation with Stephen about farming methods
Evaluate the effectiveness of compost production systems
Understand the principles behind regenerative farming
Learn about the use of worm composting systems
Discuss the transition from urban farming to potential rural land ownership
Share insights on starting a small-scale farm in a local community

tasks.task: Host a video showcasing the farm
subtasks: Film a video in the backyard and surrounding areas
Interview co-host (Nat...) about farming and personal experiences
Provide a 30,000-foot overview of regenerative farming
Answer viewers' questions related to small-scale farming and gardening
Discuss the economic aspects of operating a market garden
Highlight the benefits of local food production and direct marketing
Plan for moving to Tennessee to establish a larger farm
Research property options in Tennessee for farming
Consider environmental factors in choosing a new farm location

tasks.task: Update farming clientele and subscribers during transition
subtasks: Inform existing clients about changes in lease arrangements
Distribute information to subscribers about upcoming changes
Maintain communication with community during the transition period
